pageContext.claim: “I think it's good. I think I'm very popular in [the United Kingdon].”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's statement is exactly the opposite of what is true. In early 2016, a Pew Research Center poll found that 85 percent of Britons had no confidence in Trump. By the beginning of 2018, according to a Sunday Express poll, fewer than half of Britons thought Trump should have a state visit. The president has also had public feuds with the mayor of London and Prime Minister Theresa May.
